Katya: Let us report for duty. You shall train on the job if we fight 
now. If he has nothing, I will continue to teach you Clan lores. Do 
you know his frequency?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> Owlhawk:  Oh, then I guess it doesn't matter, but
> energon could probably fuel up your robot thing if it
> needs it.
> 
> He scarfs down a few energon cubes.
> 
> Owlhawk:  Oh well do we train, or ask Rodimus what to
> do now?
> 
> --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Katya followed him and looked at the cube he had
> > handed her, quite 
> > indifferent to it.
> > 
> > Katya: I... do not know about this... Actually, I
> > think my fusion 
> > engine sustains me on food. Now, what is happening
> > here?
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> > wrote:
> > > Owlhawk emerged a bit peckish.
> > > 
> > > Owlhawk:  Hey I'm going to get something to
> > eat.....oh
> > > I hope you can eat energon, now that you're part
> > > machine.  We don't have any actual food so far as
> > I
> > > know.
> > > 
> > > He led her to the Mess Hall and handed her an
> > energon
> > > cube.
> > > 
> > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > After some times of this repairing sleep, the
> > galaxy
> > > > commander came 
> > > > out of the chamber. Her human metabolism kept
> > her
> > > > sleepy, as she 
> > > > rubbed her eyes to shake away the slumber.
> > > > 
> > > > She waited for Owlhawk, eager to fight the
> > Maximal's
> > > > enemies.
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > Owlhawk enters a chamber as well.
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > OOC: I prefer to think of them as humans in
> > > > metal
> > > > > > shells.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Bic:
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Katya: Let us hope this works for me too.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > She enters the Chamber and enters a snoreful
> > > > sleep.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > > > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > OOC: I think half-organic half-techno
> > beings
> > > > are
> > > > > > > called either androids or cyborgs.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > BIC: Owlhawk:  The CR chamber I'll show
> > you
> > > > there.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > He took her to the CR chamber.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...>
> > wrote:
> > > > > > > > OOC: That was a new approach!
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > BIC: Katya stopped inside when she
> > reached
> > > > two
> > > > > > > > corridors.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Katya: I am glad that you learn fast.
> > For
> > > > now,
> > > > > > > > though, we will put 
> > > > > > > > your education on hold. We should repair
> > > > from
> > > > > > our
> > > > > > > > fight... at least I 
> > > > > > > > should. After that, I think we should
> > report
> > > > for
> > > > > > > > duty. So... how and 
> > > > > > > > where do I take care of my wounds?
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > She still was not used to be a machine,
> > and
> > > > > > somehow,
> > > > > > > > it scared her a 
> > > > > > > > bit. She now shared a skin-deep - no,
> > > > soul-deep
> > > > > > bond
> > > > > > > > with her mech. 
> > > > > > > > It was extremely alien to her.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > > > > > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > > Owlhawk:  Oh, makes since.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > OOC: Considering I know nothing about
> > > > > > Battletech
> > > > > > > > how
> > > > > > > > > was my guess?
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > --- warriorazure
> > <wingedwarrior41@h...>
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > Katya is taken aback by the answer.
> > Of
> > > > > > course,
> > > > > > > > she
> > > > > > > > > > couldn't expect him 
> > > > > > > > > > to know everything, but she did
> > expect
> > > > > > something
> > > > > > > > > > else.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > Katya: Drawing first blood? Of
> > course,
> > > > it is
> > > > > > an
> > > > > > > > > > approach that 
> > > > > > > > > > minimizes losses, but where is the
> > fun
> > > > in
> > > > > > that?
> > > > > > > > We
> > > > > > > > > > might as well start 
> > > > > > > > > > using dishonorable artillery right
> > away.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > She enters the base before going on.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > Katya: The bidding ritual is done in
> > two
> > > > > > parts.
> > > > > > > > > > Before a battle, we 
> > > > > > > > > > issue a batchall -a battle
> > challenge-
> > > > and
> > > > > > ask
> > > > > > > > what
> > > > > > > > > > forces the defender 
> > > > > > > > > > will use. After that, two commanders
> > bid
> > > > > > against
> > > > > > > > > > each other to bring 
> > > > > > > > > > to least troops possible to achieve
> > > > victory.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > > > > > > > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > Owlhawk:  Each side agrees to send
> > in
> > > > a
> > > > > > pre
> > > > > > > > set
> > > > > > > > > > either
> > > > > > > > > > > number or percent of warriors and
> > they
> > > > > > hold a
> > > > > > > > > > battle
> > > > > > > > > > > to the first damage rather than
> > death
> > > > to
> > > > > > > > determine
> > > > > > > > > > who
> > > > > > > > > > > goes and who stays.
> > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > He hoped his complete guess lucked
> > > > out.
> > > > > > > > > > >

> > > > Inner

> > > > > > > > > > > > warriors they'd
